item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Thanks, dougal!

item.title: Ticket #1323 (Feeds return 304 when no new posts have been made) updated
item.dc:creator: dougal
item.description:
I just uploaded wp-blog-header.diff, which I think should cover the edge cases better now.

macmanx: the 1.5.0 behavior was not completely correct. It didn't return a "304 Not Modified" response if only one of the ETag or Last Modified headers were sent by the browser, only if it sent both.

item.title: Ticket #1323 (Feeds return 304 when no new posts have been made) updated
item.dc:creator: macmanx
item.description: This may be a crazy question, but why not switch back to the way feeds were handled in v1.5.0? I can't recall anything wrong with them, certainly not on this level at least.

item.title: Ticket #1323 (Feeds return 304 when no new posts have been made) updated
item.dc:creator: dougal
item.description:
Hmmm.... When passed an empty string, strtotime() is returning a timestamp for midnight on the current day rather than treating it as an invalid date and returning -1 or 0 as I would have thought. That's pretty annoying, but it is documented on the GNU page pointed to from the PHP docs. It would have been nice if the PHP docs directly documented it, though.

Okay, so that's the crux of the problem. Knowing that, we can write a better fix. We might just want to forego attempts to write the logic 'elegantly', and just put a chunk of more verbose logic there that handles the various possibilities in a more transparent fashion.

item.title: Ticket #1347 ('publish' and 'editpost' have different flow in wp-admin/post.php) updated
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1347 ('publish' and 'editpost' have different flow in wp-admin/post.php) created
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description:
In /wp-admin/post.php, the flow of sending pings and calling publish_post plugins is different, depending on whether the action is "publish" or "editpost".

When in the 'post' case, pings are sent, then plugins using the publish_post action are activated. When in the 'editpost' case, plugins on publish_post are executed, then pings are sent.

I recommend standardizing on one; preferably calling plugins first, then doing pings.

item.title: Ticket #1324 (Unable to send/receive pingbacks and send trackbacks.) updated
item.dc:creator: macmanx
item.description:
::sigh:: More problems. This is very frustrating. I don't know how to distinguish any of this. Can we please go back to using fopen() for pingbacks and trackbacks? Here are my notes so far:

  1. I am able to send and receive pingbacks between my own blogs.
  1. I cannot send or receive trackbacks and pingbacks to or from Podz' test blog.
  1. In this post, â€‹http://www.macmanx.com/wordpress/archives/2005/05/10/wordpress-v151-bugs/, [] I sent pingbacks to all the v1.5.1 users that I know: Bryan (btvillarin), Tom (tomraftery), Podz, Craig (nuclearmoose), and Matt. Only Craig received my pingback.
  1. â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/topic/33208?page=1#post-188326 [] Moshu sent a pingback to one of my recent posts. But, I never received it.
  1. I just received a test trackback and pingback from Matt.
  1. My v1.5.0 test blog is working perfectly, as did all of my blogs before upgrading to v1.5.1.
  1. I successfully sent a pingback to both Matt and Craig (sorry guys).
  1. I received two trackbacks while I was away.
  1. I sent a trackback to Podz' test site, requested a trackback from Podz' test site, sent a pingback to Podz' test site, and requested a pingback from Podz' test site. All instances failed.
  1. I sent a trackback to Owen's test site (Pingomation), requested a trackback from Owen's test site, and requested a pingback from Owen's test site. I successfully received the requested trackback, all other instances failed. The failed requested pingback test returned the following debug info:

Error. Fault code: 16 : The source URI does not exist. POST /wordpress/xmlrpc.php HTTP/1.0 Host: www.macmanx.com Content-Type: text/xml User-Agent: The Incutio XML-RPC PHP Library -- RedAlt/Pingomation Content-length: 430

<?xml version="1.0"?> <methodCall> <methodName>pingback.ping</methodName> <params> <param><value><array><data> <value><string>â€‹http://redalt.com/pinged/http%3A%2F%2Fwww.macmanx.com%2Fwordpress%2Farchives%2F2005%2F05%2F10%2Fwordpress-v151-bugs%2F</string></value> <value><string>â€‹http://www.macmanx.com/wordpress/archives/2005/05/10/wordpress-v151-bugs/</string></value> </data></array></value></param> </params></methodCall>

<?xml version="1.0"?> <methodResponse> <fault> <value> <struct> <member> <name>faultCode</name> <value><int>16</int></value> </member> <member> <name>faultString</name> <value><string>The source URI does not exist.</string></value> </member> </struct> </value> </fault> </methodResponse>

item.title: Ticket #1341 (<!--nextpage--> navigation on permalinks with no trailing slash fails) updated

item.description:
--- template-functions-links.php (revision 2597) +++ template-functions-links.php (working copy) @@ -44,6 +44,9 @@

$permalink = get_settings('permalink_structure');

+ if (!preg_match('/\/$/',$permalink)) + $permalink .= "/"; +

if ( != $permalink && 'draft' != $post->post_status) {

$unixtime = strtotime($post->post_date);

@@ -489,4 +492,4 @@

}

}

-?> \ No newline at end of file +?>

item.title: Ticket #1324 (Unable to send/receive pingbacks and send trackbacks.) updated
item.dc:creator: macmanx
item.description:
The score so far after two more tests:

  1. I am able to send and receive pingbacks between my own blogs.
  1. I cannot send or receive trackbacks and pingbacks to or from Podz' test blog.
  1. In this post, â€‹http://www.macmanx.com/wordpress/archives/2005/05/10/wordpress-v151-bugs/, I sent pingbacks to all the v1.5.1 users that I know: Bryan (btvillarin), Tom (tomraftery), Podz, Craig (nuclearmoose), and Matt. Only Craig received my pingback.
  1. â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/topic/33208?page=1#post-188326 Moshu sent a pingback to one of my recent posts. But, I never received it.
  1. I just received a test trackback and pingback from Matt.
  1. My v1.5.0 test blog is working perfectly, as did all of my blogs before upgrading to v1.5.1.
  1. I successfully sent a pingback to both Matt and Craig (sorry guys).
  1. I received two trackbacks while I was away.

This is all very confusing, but it looks like I am having no trouble sending or receiving pingbacks. ::sigh:: Unfortunately, most of the blogs that I have attempted to test against, are having difficulty receiving my pingbacks.

It looks like I'm in the clear, but there plenty of other individuals who are currently having problems with trackbacks and pingbacks.

item.title: Ticket #1342 (default theme: archive.php: the_excerpt should be the_content ?) updated
item.dc:creator: carnaticwm
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1342 (default theme: archive.php: the_excerpt should be the_content ?) created
item.dc:creator: carnaticwm
item.description:
Greetings,

I had reported this issue under issue 698 and it seems to have been deleted ( â€‹http://www.google.com/search?q=wordpress+html+not+rendered+correctly )

archive.php in the default theme contains

... <?php the_excerpt() ?> ...

due to which category archive pages are not generated correctly

If the above code is replaced with

... <?php the_content('Read the rest of this entry »'); ?> ...

The generation is working as expected...

Cheers, Kishore.

item.title: Ticket #1341 (<!--nextpage--> navigation on permalinks with no trailing slash fails) updated
item.dc:creator: Joen
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1341 (<!--nextpage--> navigation on permalinks with no trailing slash fails) created
item.dc:creator: Joen
item.description:
When using rewritten permalinks with no trailing slashes, for instance /%year%/%monthnum%/%postname% Paged post navigation fails working.

Quite simply, what should have been /%year%/%monthnum%/%postname%/2/ ends being /%year%/%monthnum%/%postname%2/

Note: /%year%/%monthnum%/%postname%/2/ will still work, but the paged navigation won't link to this.

item.title: Ticket #1325 (Unable to ping Ping-o-Matic) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Heh, we're winding up with the same discussion on both the support forum and on here, but I guess I'll keep it up for anyone only following along at one place. :)

This isn't a real fix, it's just a workaround. Getting rid of that line makes it so WP never tries to use the new "extended ping" bit that was added in 1.5.1, which seems to have some bug that was making pings not work for us. It shouldn't be able to break anything else or have any other negative effects.

-- Herschel

item.title: Ticket #1340 (why even admin does not see all private posts) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1340 (why even admin does not see all private posts) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: As an admin I find it quite awkward that registered users that are elevated to level 1 or higher can fill my blog database with private posts that I am in no way aware of.. Especially now when their private posts are visible to them on the public side without publishing, it is ok, but they can share a login and use my blog in their own intentions. :) Of course it is ok that other users (even with higher levels) do not see others private posts, but at least admin should have some way of knowing what is happening. Trying to scan the database occassionally is no good in the long run...

item.title: Ticket #1325 (Unable to ping Ping-o-Matic) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
This seems to be a bug in extended ping, but I don't know why it works on most sites but not on mine and macmanx's. In the weblog_ping function in functions.php I changed:

if ( !$client->query('weblogUpdates.extendedPing', get_settings('blogname'), $home, get_bloginfo('rss2_url') ) ) then try a normal ping

$client->query('weblogUpdates.ping', get_settings('blogname'), $home);

to just be:

$client->query('weblogUpdates.ping', get_settings('blogname'), $home);

so that it always does a normal ping. This made it work for me.

Of course, it could be that macmanx's problem is a different one than mine, but the symptons have been the same so far...

edited on: 05-11-05 06:07

item.title: Ticket #1323 (Feeds return 304 when no new posts have been made) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: No, that's not enough. You have to fix the tests too, they do not work correctly if client_last_modified is an empty string currently.

item.title: Ticket #1323 (Feeds return 304 when no new posts have been made) updated
item.dc:creator: dougal
item.description:
I think a better check would be to use !empty() instead of isset() when setting the variable, with a trim() for good measure:

if (!empty($_SERVERHTTP_IF_MODIFIED_SINCE?))

$client_last_modified = trim($_SERVERHTTP_IF_MODIFIED_SINCE?);

This way, we won't set the variable if the browser didn't send the header. And even if they send whitespace for the value, we'll set an empty string, which will fail the boolean tests later.

item.dc:creator: macmanx
item.description:
More info from my error logs:

[10-May-2005 10:43:30] PHP Warning: fclose(): supplied argument is not a valid stream resource in ///*/wordpress/xmlrpc.php on line 1189 [10-May-2005 10:43:30] PHP Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at ///*/wordpress/xmlrpc.php:1189) in ///*/wordpress/wp-includes/class-IXR.php on line 371 [10-May-2005 10:43:30] PHP Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at ///*/wordpress/xmlrpc.php:1189) in ///*/wordpress/wp-includes/class-IXR.php on line 372 [10-May-2005 10:43:30] PHP Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at ///*/wordpress/xmlrpc.php:1189) in ///*/wordpress/wp-includes/class-IXR.php on line 373 [10-May-2005 10:43:30] PHP Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at ///*/wordpress/xmlrpc.php:1189) in ///*/wordpress/wp-includes/class-IXR.php on line 374

The "headers already sent" errors appear to be caused by the "supplied argument is not a valid stream resource" error.

edited on: 05-10-05 18:31

item.title: Ticket #473 (Pings for future-dated posts should be sent at specified future date/time) updated
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description:
post.php calls pingback() and do_trackbacks() regardless of the date assigned to the post. Each of these calls ought to be wrapped inside an if { } to make sure that the post's date is not set in the future.

Then a plugin (one on which I'm currently working!) can register a publish_post function to record posts which need to generate pings, and do so at the appropriate time.

item.title: Ticket #1257 (Pingbacks sent from wrong URI for posts first published in advanced ...) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: In 1.5.1, draft posts are not given a permalink GUID since the post slug is not set on a draft post. Instead, a query string GUID is used. Once pubilshed, the GUID should be updated so that a proper permalink-style GUID is used. The GUID life cycle should be similar to the post slug lifecycle. Leave the GUID blank for draft posts. Set the GUID once published.

item.title: Ticket #1324 (Unable to send/receive pingbacks and send trackbacks.) updated
item.dc:creator: macmanx
item.description: Ok, pingbacks and trackbacks are once again completely not functional.

item.title: Ticket #1334 (Wrong date-format in the RSS-feed) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
-Line 27: < ?php echo mysql2date('D, d M Y H:i:s +0000', get_lastpostmodified('GMT'), 0); ?> -Line 36: < ?php echo mysql2date('D, d M Y H:i:s +0000', get_the_time('Y-m-d H:i:s')); ?>

Those lines are from the 1.5 version of wp-rss2.php, not 1.5.1. 1.5.1 looks like this:

<?php echo mysql2date('D, d M Y H:i:s +0000', get_lastpostmodified('GMT'), false); ?>

<?php echo mysql2date('D, d M Y H:i:s +0000', get_post_time('Y-m-d H:i:s', true), false); ?>

item.title: Ticket #1323 (Feeds return 304 when no new posts have been made) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Uploaded corrected diff

item.title: Ticket #1323 (Feeds return 304 when no new posts have been made) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
The problem is with client_last_modified. If it is empty, wp-blog-header.php calls strtotime("") and that returns '00:00:00 of the current day'.

Adding an extra '$client_last_modified &&' fixes the problem. Diff is in the attachment.

edited on: 05-10-05 15:01

item.title: Ticket #1334 (Wrong date-format in the RSS-feed) updated
item.dc:creator: jowra
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1334 (Wrong date-format in the RSS-feed) created
item.dc:creator: jowra
item.description: There seems to be an error in the <pubdate>-definition of the wp-rss2.php. The dates are not RFC-822 compatible, therefore the RSS 2.0 feed is not validating at the feed-validator and most of the known feedreaders will show up strange dates for the posts (e.g. 1970-01-01).

item.title: Ticket #1331 (SQL Error with list_cats) updated
item.dc:creator: mikelittle
item.description:
Patch changed

Turn on optiondates in a call to list_cats i.e. call wp_list_cats('optiondates=1') in your template. SQL error will result.

item.title: Ticket #1331 (SQL Error with list_cats) created
item.dc:creator: mikelittle
item.description:
Change 2551 â€‹http://trac.wordpress.org/changeset/2551 introduced an SQL error in function list_cats with $optiondates switched on.

The query on line 291 tries to select cat_ID from wp_posts joined with wp_post2cat. This latter table only has column category_id. The reference to the results on line 297 needs changingb too.

--

item.title: Ticket #1330 (User Registration Default set to Level 1) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1330 (User Registration Default set to Level 1) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When a user registers, their user level defaults to level 1. This means that not only can they create posts on their own, but they can also see ip addresses and email addresses of other authors and guests. This seems to me to be a security flaw. There should be an easy way to change the default, so that users automatically start at level 0 and if the admin wants, can promote them.

item.title: Ticket #1329 (Support for summer time / DST) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1329 (Support for summer time / DST) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: It would be nice to have support for summer time, so WordPress automagically could adjust itself accordingly. There should probably be an option to enable/disable this, as not everyone uses summer time, and also a notice that the offset is treated as offset during the winter.

item.title: Ticket #263 (Email Notification headers wrong) closed
item.dc:creator: mikelittle
item.description:
his bug has been reintroduced as part of this change â€‹http://trac.wordpress.org/changeset/2556

The 'mime-type' header once again has \r\n after is resulting in the termination of the header parsing for some MUAs BEFORE the 'from' header which also has the same problem.

This now needs fixing in pluggable-functions.php The \r\n sequence needs changing back to \n in 4 places.

item.title: Ticket #1324 (Unable to send/receive pingbacks and send trackbacks.) updated
item.dc:creator: macmanx
item.description:
I made it work! Huuzzzah! I guess I just had to hit it like an old toaster. Here's what I did (make sure you have time to try it, because it worked for me, and I'm not trying it any other way).

  1. Send a pingback from one post in v1.5.1 blog to another post in the same blog. Confirm that pingbacks do not work.
  1. Set up a brand new v1.5.0 blog (hope you have a back up).
  1. Send a pingback from one post in v1.5.0 blog to another post in the same blog. Confirm that pingbacks are working correctly.
  1. Send a pingback from one post in the v1.5.0 blog to another in the v1.5.1 blog. Confirm that pingbacks are working correctly (they should by now).
  1. Send a pingback from one post in the v1.5.1 blog to another in the v1.5.0 blog. Confirm that pingbacks are working correctly.
  1. Send a pingback from one post in v1.5.1 blog to another post in the same blog. Confirm that pingbacks are working correctly.

That's the best I can do to describe it ... and it still doesn't make sense. But at least the pingbacks are working.

item.title: Ticket #1328 (Posting or saving hangs with Amazon URL in post) updated
item.dc:creator: marv
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1328 (Posting or saving hangs with Amazon URL in post) created
item.dc:creator: marv
item.description:
This is my first bug report, so excuse me if I somehow mess up.

Today I noticed that whenever I post or save an entry that has an Amazon URL to in it, then the page just sits there and nothing happens. But the entry gets saved. This happens in Firefox and IE. Here is an example URL that was giving me trouble today: â€‹http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0738857459/qid=1115698526/sr=1-1/ref=sr_1_1/102-7289909-3860938?v=glance&s=books

This happened in 1.5 also.

item.title: Ticket #1325 (Unable to ping Ping-o-Matic) updated
item.dc:creator: macmanx
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1325 (Unable to ping Ping-o-Matic) created
item.dc:creator: macmanx
item.description:
When I post (with ping-o-matic in the update services), none of ping-o-matic's services are notified. However, If I post with all of ping-o-matic's services entered separately into the update services field (blo.gs, weblogs.com, technorati, etc.), they are successfully notified. And I have attempted as many troubleshooting steps as I know, including re-upgrading from the .tar.gz version (previously used the .zip version), using a different FTP app to upload the files, and testing trackbacks/pingbacks with all plugins deactivated and using the default theme. I'm out of ideas, and I'm pretty sure this is a WP bug as I had no problems with pinging ping-o-matic in WP v1.5.

I should also add that my server error logs are empty for today, and that I am having any issue with pingbacks (bug# 1324) which may be related.

If you would like it, my phpinfo file is available upon request via email to james at macmerc dot com.

item.title: Ticket #1324 (Unable to send/receive pingbacks and send trackbacks.) updated
item.dc:creator: macmanx
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1324 (Unable to send/receive pingbacks and send trackbacks.) created
item.dc:creator: macmanx
item.description:
After upgrading to WP v1.5.1, I can receive trackbacks, but I cannot send trackbacks, nor can I send or receive pingbacks. My server error logs are absolutely blank. And I have attempted as many troubleshooting steps as I know, including re-upgrading from the .tar.gz version (previously used the .zip version), using a different FTP app to upload the files, and testing trackbacks/pingbacks with all plugins deactivated and using the default theme. I'm out of ideas, and I'm pretty sure this is a WP bug as I had no problems with pingbacks or trackbacks in WP v1.5.

If you would like it, my phpinfo file is available upon request via email to james at macmerc dot com.

item.title: Ticket #1323 (Feeds return 304 when no new posts have been made) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: While checking that I hadn't broken my WP install by upgrading to 1.5.1, I discovered that all of the feeds were returning 304 for all requests, no matter if they should be returning 200 + content or not. When I posted a new entry the feeds began to behave correctly again.
